page.title: 02Survey of Berwick, Sussex.
page.content: There are approximately 72 residences in Berwick. 20 questionnaires were delivered at random representing 28%. 10 questionnaires were completed, that is 14%. Only one child of pre-school age was discovered. 5 people are in secondary education, and 3 in further education. 16 people are of employable age and 5 retired. Length of residence in 2 cases was less than one year. Two households had been in residence for up to 20 years and in 2 the occupants had been born in the area, one family having been farming in the locality for 100 years. All homes have their own transport. 5 families came for rural surroundings, 2 for work, 1 for retirement, 3 feared overdevelopment, 1 hoped for limited house building & 2 for the railway station to stay. 4 were worried about lack of speed restrictions through the village.
